lines.text: [towards the end, Goofy has fully recovered from the cold and is back at work two weeks later]
And so, two weeks later, Mr. Geef's cold has run its natural course and once again, Mr. Geef felt just like a human being. Mr. Geef was firmly convinced that a cold is nothing to be sneezed at.

The carrier of the common cold is a tiny virus easily identified by his red nose. Although the virus wins few friends, he "influenzas" many people. Sometimes the average man seems to deliberately try to catch cold.
[Goofy AKA George Geef has caught a cold and his boss catches him sneezing]
Geef! Take that cold outta here!

[clearly congested]
But boss, look. I don't have a cold.
[He sneezes again, knocking the phone off his desk]
Now look, Geef. A cold is nothing to be sneezed at.

[Goofy had been sent home from work early because of a cold he has]
Poor Geef, an outcast from society, shunned by a cruel, cold world.

[returning home and sneezing the front door open]
Hello?
[sees note on table and reads it]
"Honey, playing bridge at Mabel's. Dinner in icebox." Deserted!
Deserted by the ones he loves the most in his hour of need, alone with his misery.
